frameDefinitions: Words in the frame refer to any Document that has a legal status or conventional social significance.
An Agent avoids an Undesirable_situation under certain Circumstances.
A particular Binding_principle is (or is not) operative, that is, any obligations, restrictions, and any other aspects of the Binding_principle are (or are not) in effect.
A Process is finished and can no longer proceed.
A Phenomenon, which may be an activity, state or object, is purposefully hidden from the awareness of a potential Cognizer.
Words in this frame describe the status of an Action with respect to a Code of laws or rules.
frameExamples: They got their marriage <t>licence</t> from Canada.
Mike <t>avoided</t> his supervisor at all costs.
This law will only become in <t>effect</t> during the last three weeks of the year.
Few people would use ATMs if the content of their transaction was <t>secret</t> from their bank and there was no paper trail verifying the transaction. .
<t>Illegal</t> drug use is on the rise.
listRoleDefinitions: The holder of the document.
The authority that issues the document.
Obligation is the obligation that is imposed on the <fen>Bearer</fen> of the <fen>Document</fen>.
Right is the right of the <fen>Bearer</fen> of the <fen>Document</fen>  that is authorized by the <fen>Document</fen>.
Status is the state of the Bearer of the Document indicated by the Document.
Document is the piece of paper that has the legal status.
The <fen>Agent</fen> avoids an <fen>Undesirable_situation</fen>.
This role identifies the situation that the <fen>Agent</fen> avoids.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the avoiding occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the avoiding occurs.
The <fen>Binding_principle</fen> is the law, contract, principle, or other (set of) obligations that is (or is not) operational.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Binding_principle</fen> is in effect.
The <fen>Place</fen> at which the <fen>Binding_principle</fen> is or is not operational.
This role identifies the name of the <fen>Process</fen> that occurs.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
The <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is the activity, state or object that is purposefully hidden from the awareness of a potential cognizer.
A period of <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is hidden from the awareness of potential cognizers.
The <fen>Action</fen> is the behavior which complies with or violates the <fen>Code</fen>.
The <fen>Object</fen> complies with or violates the <fen>Code</fen> by virtue of its existence, location or possession.
listRoleExamples: <fex>US consulate</fex> issued a Visa to Ms. Yang to travel to San Francisco.
They were all under subpoena <fex>to appear in court.</fex>
The couple just got their <fex>marriage</fex> certificate.
The police need a search <fex><t>warrant</t></fex> to enter his house.
<fex>Mike</fex> avoided his supervisor at all costs.
Mike avoided <fex>his supervisor</fex> at all costs.
Once <fex>the treaty</fex> is in effect, US port authorities and the Coast Guard will monitor compliance by checking any yacht 79 feet or longer.
All patent applicants and owners should be aware of the current uncertainty as to what patent fees will be in effect <fex>on October 1, 1998</fex>
This promotion is void <fex>in the state of Florida</fex>.
There was stuff in there that was 'secret' <fex>in the 1980s</fex>, but has since become pretty common knowledge.
Illegal <fex>drug use</fex> is on the rise.
